description: EC2 http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html defines error codes for certain situations. For instance the boto python library expect they are set correctly. https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/develop/boto/ec2/connection.py#L2100 The above function should return None when the keypair does not exists. Now it raise an exception with the 'EC2APIError' error Code:  boto.exception.EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 400 Bad Request EC2APIErrorCould not find key pair(s): random-namereq-c08b0aab-7437-4289-be12-c99977597812 Internally the Code must be 'InvalidKeyPair.NotFound' I have attached an example code for easier issue reproducing . Note: I think status code 404 describes better the situation than 400 openstack-nova-api-2012.2-1.fc18.noarch affected. Earlier versions affected too. Not tested with newer version (git).
title: Incorrect ec2 error code (DescribeKeyPairs)

comments.content: EC2 http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html defines error codes for certain situations. For instance the boto python library expect they are set correctly. https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/develop/boto/ec2/connection.py#L2100 The above function should return None when the keypair does not exists. Now it raise an exception with the 'EC2APIError' error Code: boto.exception.EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 400 Bad Request EC2APIErrorCould not find key pair(s): random-namereq-c08b0aab-7437-4289-be12-c99977597812 Internally the Code must be 'InvalidKeyPair.NotFound' I have attached an example code for easier issue reproducing . Note: Probably not just the 'DescribeKeyPairs' affected. openstack-nova-api-2012.2-1.fc18.noarch affected. Earlier versions affected too. Not tested with newer version (git).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content:
The error code issues are more general than I expected:
http://wiki.openstack.org/blueprint-ec2-error-codes
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/18876
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/5cce71baaa13fc651d76b6b26a29effbf879f1b1
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 5cce71baaa13fc651d76b6b26a29effbf879f1b1
Author: Chuck Short <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Jan 3 09:04:58 2013 -0600

    Refactor EC2 keypairs exception
    
    According to the following document:
    
    http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html
    
    The EC2 API sends specific error codes when keypair listing or
    keypair generation fails, specifically the error codes are
    
    InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate - duplicate keypair
    InvalidKeyPair.Format - keypair format invalid
    InvalidKeyPair.NotFound - keypair not found
    ResourceLimitExceeded - keypair quota exceeded
    
    Refactored create_key_pair and describe_key_pair so that
    it throws the correct EC2 error codes according to the
    public EC2 API specs.
    
    Also removed some duplicate exceptions as well.
    
    Fixes LP: 1072318
    
    DocImpact
    
    Change-Id: Ib7045e49211d9300e9cb6ca0bfe80e569d635c9b
    Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <email address hidden>
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: The previous change fixed the InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate issue, but looks like it does not covers the case tested by the attached test file. $ python test_ec2_keys.py Traceback (most recent call last): File "test.py", line 71, in ec2_connection.get_key_pair("random-name") File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/boto/ec2/connection.py", line 2091, in get_key_pair return self.get_all_key_pairs(keynames=[keyname])[0] File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/boto/ec2/connection.py", line 2078, in get_all_key_pairs [('item', KeyPair)], verb='POST') File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 980, in get_list raise self.ResponseError(response.status, response.reason, body) boto.exception.EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 400 Bad Request KeypairNotFoundCould not find key pair(s): random-namereq-d3aaa498-6eba-4c17-b3b7-25a8edca0ab8
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content: The issue still persists, the change fixed an another issue.

comments.content: I have tested this bug on the Juno release and for the non existing key we can see 404 error message in the api.log and also  its returning the "None" value to the user.
